page.title: 02GENERAL REVIEW, ATTITUDES
page.content: the flood plain of the River Little Dart that the American Life Magazine team took the picture looking up to Chulmleigh which became their cover picture for their book on Britain. The streams and rivers have incised the 200 metre plateau. The population of Chulmleigh has for centuries been about 1200. {ATTITUDES} Compared to urban areas, life in a Mid Devon rural area tends to be more casual, slower, more relaxed. Certainly a more enjoyable quality of life is evident. People passing on the streets wish each other the time of the day, mention the weather, and not infrequently spend a few minutes in a friendly discussion. Everyone tends to know everyone's business and, indeed, if someone is ill people appear concerned and readily volunteer to help-in-any-way!
